Description: Rim sherd of a large Attic red-figured pottery lid; interior glazed; underside of rim reserved; exterior: red-figure decoration; on vertical face of rim, lotus (three dots in lotus flower) and enclosed palmette chain; on top, standing male figure, possibly Herakles, to right, knee slightly bent, left leg (only thigh remaining) raised; two paws and tail of lion skin hanging behind him; at left, extensive remains of added white - landscape or floral?
Curator's comments: The sherd is also published in Luce, S. B. ‘Heracles and the Old Man of the Sea’, American Journal of Archaeology 26, 1922, 191.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E812.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0836) (Phase 1)
